Today, 51 years after Stonewall, we remember the courageous LBGTQ+ New Yorkers and activists, led by trans women of color, who fought back and sparked a movement for equal rights. This fight must continue with all of us today. #Pride

“Whoever finds his life will lose it,and whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.”

Matthew 10:39

Today, we remember Stonewall and the powerful uprisings—led by trans women of color—that transformed our country. The struggle for LGBTQ+ equality continues today and we must all be willing partners in this fight. #PrideMonth

51 years ago at Stonewall, brave LBGTQ+ New Yorkers—led by transgender women of color—galvanized a movement. To honor their legacy, we must continue to speak out against transphobia and homophobia in our nation. We cannot relent. Work still remains to ensure equal rights for all.
